results.title: Autumn of a mining town
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Perhaps due to its fascinating past and equally astonishing present, the Victorian gold rush town of Ballarat catches the quintessence of Victorian Australia - the curious old homes; the old tramcars; the coffee palace; the Cobb & Co office; the gardens and the people. No narration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Man's life is his own affair
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan, Brian Hannant, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel or People”.
An office-worker participates in a demonstration and his face is recognised by management in a front page newspaper photograph. Deals with the responsibilities of an employee towards his employer versus his rights as a citizen. Is a man free to do as he pleases outside working hours provided that it does not adversely affect his work?

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan, Brian Hannant, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Leaf
results.brief_description: Captures the spirit of Autumn in the wilderness, by blending the elements of wind and leaf in a visually and rhythmically enchanting study of California’s Yosemite valley.

results.title: You've got to work for it (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A film made by six Diploma of Education students (Bob Sharples, Kamal Monsour, Sally Ford, Derek Burrage, Denis Connolly and Doug Eastman) about the problem migrant adolescents face in Australia. Through group discussions between Italian immigrants, Greek immigrants and first generation immigrant children, a real portrayal of the frustration of immigrant teenagers growing up in Australia is shown. Also gives a brief background history of Greek/Italian migration in the 1960’s and 1970’s from an economical/political point of view. Broadmeadows

results.title: Your body during adolescence
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Health and Safety for You”.
Eighteen young people from thirteen to fifteen are shown to vary widely in size and shape, although all are changing from childhood to adulthood. The film mentions the general functions of the endocrine glands and the influence of the pituitary glands on growth changes, which may normally occur in any order. The structure and functioning of the male and female reproductive organs are outlined.

results.title: You and Your Vote
results.creator_credit: Douglas White, Loch Townsend, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: In an attempt to overcome informal voting in Senate elections, an account is given of the work of the Electoral Office and the correct way in which a vote should be recorded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Douglas White, Loch Townsend, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Workout
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An impressionistic study of the relationship between horse and rider during a work out. To compete in Olympic equestrian events young riders must practice daily, sharpening their own skill and that of their horses. Shows the world as it must appear to horse and rider on a foggy morning in the Australian bush.

results.title: Wool Fashion Awards 1967
results.brief_description: Models are posed against a variety of Melbourne’s buildings such as Melbourne University, Fitzroy Gardens, National Gallery of Victoria…both interior and exterior backgrounds are used. We see the award winning garments: slack suits, lounging pyjamas, coats and dresses for both day and evening wear.

results.title: Wool Fashion Awards of 1960
results.brief_description: Every year, a fashion contest to promote wool as a fabric is held by the Australian Wool Bureau. In 1960, Melbourne compered the awards and this film shows many of the winning entries in the fifty-five sections. Those modelled include suits, coats, dresses, knitwear and slacks. The supreme award for 1960 is the climax of the parade of gold medal winners, held at the end of four days judging.
